results.title: The Fight continues
results.creator_credit: Czechoslovak Film, World Health Organisation and Vaclav Bedrich
results.brief_description: This short animated film describes briefly the aims and work of the World Health Organisation: to fight disease and help give to every human being their fundamental right to the highest attainable standard of health.

results.title: The Fifth facade
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Anthony Buckley and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Records the construction and the official opening of the Sydney Opera House. Joern Utzon, the Danish architect provides the commentary and says: “One could not design a building for such an exposed position without paying attention to the roof, one must have a fifth facade”. Exterior sequences of the Opera House are blended with scenes of rehearsals.

results.title: The Field mouse
results.creator_credit: Scandinavian Videocassette Group and Steve Helling
results.brief_description: The life cycle, habits and characteristics of the field mouse are shown in the context of its ecosystem. Highlights factors such as food availability, predators, population levels and adaptive behaviour. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Field
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International, Noel Pearson and Jim Sheridan
results.brief_description: Bull McCabe (Richard Harris) and his son Tadgh (Sean Bean) have sacrificed their lives for the sake of turning the land of a local widower into a successful field but when she says she wants to sell to the highest bidder at public auction, there is no guarantee that the McCabe’s history with the land will guarantee future ownership. Bull’s biggest fear that the field will be taken over by an outsider becomes a reality when “The American” (Tom Berenger) arrives in their small Irish town. Without any cash or other means at their disposal, the only resistance the McCabes can offer is violence, continuing a trend of tragedy that has dogged the family for years. Brenda Fricker co-stars as Bull’s silent and long suffering wife, John Hurt as the simpleton “Bird”. Set in Ireland in the 1930s and based on the play “The Field” by John B. Keane.

results.title: The Fiddlers of James Bay
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Mark Zannis and Bob Rodgers
results.brief_description: Scots from the Orkney Islands came to trade in Northern Quebec during the 17th century. They brought fiddles with them and introduced a new form of music to the Cree of James Bay. The music survived long after the Scots returned home. In this film two Cree fiddlers travel to the Orkney Islands, the birthplace of the music they learned from their fathers and grandfathers. The film captures the warmth and good will of this reunion.

results.title: The Fibre web
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper Films, Alan Harper and Henry Cooper
results.brief_description: Shows the manufacture of high-quality paper in Scotland, and its uses throughout the world. Today, the uses of paper extend beyond visible applications for books, or maps, labels, or cheques, to become the insulators for telephone cables, giant transformers or computers. Narrated by Kenneth Horne.

results.title: The Ferrara poems
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, S A Department for the Arts and Jenny Robertson
results.brief_description: Two Australian travellers Karl (Michael Snelling) and Giselle (Kerin Murray) meet up with friends at a cafe in Italy for coffee and discuss their cultural experiences and observations of the country. A trip is planned and the group sets off together on another sight-seeing adventure. A postmodernist film essay exploring the structure of storytelling through the deliberate raw use of cinematic and film making devices (making those devices transparent). A film about foreigners, film making and foreign processes. Cast also includes: Ken Bolton, Mark Thomson and Tish Banks. Narrator: Richard Grayson.

results.title: The Ferals
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Wendy Gray and David Evans
results.brief_description: The Ferals are the original urban wild bunch. Rattus is tough, streetwise and constantly arguing with Modigliana, the cat with a definite sense of style, if not taste. With Mixy the rabbit and Derryn, the not too bright dog, they hang out in the shed at the bottom of Joe’s garden. “An explosion of talent”: The Feral’s performance at a talent quest is helped enormously by Leonard’s new invention - the Digital Volume Enhancer, until Modi pulls the wrong switch. “Double trouble”: As if one Rattus wasn’t trouble enough! Rattus and Joe’s ‘get-rich’quick’ scheme goes awfully wrong so it’s just as well that the Digital Duplicator has a reverse mode.
